DOC.brief_summary: After endoscopic resection (ER) of gastric tumors, eradication of Helicobacter pylori (H. pylori) infection is advised to reduce metachronous recurrence. However, few studies have addressed factors influencing H. pylori eradication rates in the aftermath of ER, and none have focused on the optimal timing of therapy to eradicate H. pylori post-ER.Therefore, the investigators will conduct to evaluate whether differences in timing of eradication therapy after ER of gastric tumors.
DOC.brief_title: Optimal Initiation of Helicobacter Pylori Eradication After Endoscopic Resection for Gastric Neoplasm
DOC.criteria: 1. patients underwent endoscopic resection of gastric neoplasm 2. patients who diagnosed as H. pylori infection by rapid urease test 1. Histories of gastric surgery 2. Histories of prior H. pylori eradication therapy 3. Use of drugs affecting H. pylori positivity (proton pump inhibitor, histamine2 receptor blocker, or antibiotics) within the preceding 2 weeks
